title: CBC Radio
text:
Vincenzo Natali is a Canadian director known for making horror films that interrogate broad questions about fear, evil and the human condition. His latest film, In The Tall Grass, is based on the 2012 novella of the same name by Stephen King and his son Joe Hill. Natali joined q guest host Angeline Tetteh-Wayoe to talk about the new film and the greater lessons that horror can teach us about life.

In The Tall Grass is on Netflix now.

Download our podcast or click the 'Listen' link near the top of this page to hear the full conversation with Vincenzo Natali.

— Produced by ​Matt Amha
